availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James William Moore (Montgomery Co, KY, attorney, judge.Representative (Confederate))

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney, judge, and politician. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Member of the Whig Party and Democratic Party. Circuit court judge of the 10th Kentucky Judicial District from 1851 to 1858. Member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Member of the Committee on Military Affairs and the Committee on the Judiciary for the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Represented the Tenth Congressional District in the House of Representatives of the First and Second Confederate Congress from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl:

Lewis Collins and Richard Collins, History of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Collins & Company, 1882), 353.
LeRoy P. Graf, et al., eds., The Papers of Andrew Johnson: September 1865,--January 1866, vol. 9 (Knoxville: University of Tennessee Press, 1967), 185.
“Death of Judge James W. Moore,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), September 20, 1877.
